intro: Acer tschonoskii subsp. australe, commonly known as the Australian maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by samaras that aid in seed dispersal. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy ornamental species. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
